result.execSummary:
The defendant Brendan M Gentz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Corrected Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt:
CASES: 15CF126 & 15CF338. Defendant Brendan M Gentz in court with attorney Frederick A Bechtold.  Defendant Brendan M Gentz in custody.  Daniel Joseph Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NE-Clerk 9:29. ADA gives status - rev. packet filed. PCR. 9:53 adj. 

SENTENCING: 

SAR - 15CF126 - Ct 12 months in PCJ.

SAR - 15CF338 - Ct 12 months concurrent in PCJ. 

Ct elig. for good time and work release. Ct 169 days sent. credit.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 29, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Voucher to DOA for Polk Co Treas to pay $420.00 Ct App'ted Atty Fees to Atty Kemp and $588.96 Ct App'ted Atty Fees to Eckberg/Lammers - Cases 15CF338, 15CF126 - No Assessment.
Atty Kemp $420.00  Eckberg-Lammers $588.96
Original in 15CF126

Defendant Brendan M Gentz in court with attorney Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. KM- 8:37 a.m.  to include files:  15CF338,15CF126.  Counsel waives right to PSI.  Brendan Gentz S&T, 8:41 a.m. CT-takes break to have State file Information and Atty Kemp to complete waiver of PH form.  Back on record,8:46 a.m.  State has now filed Information for 15CF338.  Atty Kemp has filed waiver of PH in 15CF338.  CT-finds the waiver of PH is made FVI&K and order bound over for trial.  Def pleas N/G to ct 1 in 15CF338, Def pleas N/G to ct 1 in 15CF126.  CT-goes over plea questionnaire, finds pleas in both cases is made FVI&K, accepts plea and finds guilty in Ct 1 in 15CF126 and Ct 1 in 15CF338 and enter JOC, dismiss outright ct 2 and 3 in 15CF126 and cts 2-4 in 15CF126.  State/Atty-gives recommendation, def speaks.  Lynn Taylor (friend of Mr. Gentz)- speaks to the ct.  


CT-SENTENCE- w/hold sent 15cF126, place on probation 3 years, appear at probation today, bank 180 days jail time, no jail time upfront, aoda and compliance, absolute sobriety, fine/cost $290.60, DNA surcharge $250, convicted felon, cannot posses firearm, have to be in compliance w/CHIPS order, 15cF338-w/hold sent, probation 3 years, bank additional 180 days in jail, absolute sobriety, aoda and compliance, fine/costs $290.60 not assessing adidtion DNA surcharge, no sentence credit, probation will run concurrent, Atty to go over appeal rights.  Adjourn 9:09 a.m.
Jury trial at 05-10-2016 08:30 am
